intro: Furera annua, commonly known as the annual furera, is an annual herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a common sight in disturbed habitats. Due to its rapid growth cycle, it is often used in ecological restoration projects.
